definition: to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He worked hard, though still poor in health.
sentences.chinese: 他固然身体不好，可是任务起来很卖力气。

sentences.english: The manager threatened his men with dismissal in order to bully them into working harder.
sentences.chinese: 经理以解雇来威胁职工，迫使他们更卖力气。

sentences.english: No mater where he works, he is always working hard.
sentences.chinese: 无论他在哪儿干活，他总是很卖力气。

sentences.english: China's aggressiveness makes them a difficult team to beat.
sentences.chinese: 中国队非常的卖力气，这使他们很难战胜。

sentences.english: Not brilliant, Robyn, but I'll give you ten out of ten for effort.
sentences.chinese: 做得不算顶好，罗宾，但要论卖力气我给你打满分。

sentences.english: Bob is working very hard and he even offered to work overtime.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃工作很卖力气，他还主动加班工作。

definition: to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
to work/to be employed
bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
work/(lots of) things to do
to have difficulty getting by/to struggle (financially etc)
erhua variant of 苦活[ku3 huo2]
to resort to tricks/to act in a slippery way/to try to evade (work, responsibility)
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
bitter work/sweated labor
odd jobs
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]
